job_title: Medical Laboratory Assistant in London, England
pros: nice team learn a lot
cons: biochemistry department is hectic pay is not great

pros: Diverse staff at most levels. Staff are very friendly especially the coffee shop. Canteen food is good and great value considering the location.
cons: There is no diversity at the executive level. The chief executive runs the hospital like it is a hotel as the board is dominated by non-clinical staff. He has no previous experience of healthcare and his clinical team until 2 replacements recently were very weak. Sadly the new board has no people of colour on it despite recruiting 3 new members in the last year. Key staff also ‘disappear’ regularly with no real explanations and this is quite unsettling for all staff. Training gaps exist however these are not looked at and instead training is offered to those they don’t want to disappear.

pros: Work life balance Great pay package Discount breakfast and lunch Ideal location Great opportunity
cons: Short staffed Stressful environment Micromanagement

review_title: I've grown in my role and still here 12 years later
job_title: Head of Pharmacy in London, England
pros:
Very caring organisation with good benefits with a focus on developing staff so they can grow in their roles and be ready for the next step.
Not part of a multinational profit making organisation so all money made at The London Clinic is invested back into the organisation to advance healthcare.
As a charity the ethos is different to other independent sector hospitals.
Its bigger than it looks!
cons: Although it is bigger than it looks it is still not a large national organisation so opportunities exist only within the specialties and staff groups at the London Clinic.

pros: Immediate colleagues are nice to work with
cons: Always more to do no increase in salary

review_title: Never been happier in my job

-salary is good
-cool and caring superiors
-workload is a lot lighter compared to my previous job in NHS, way way better
-majority of the patients are so polite and respectful to everyone.
I really love it here
cons:
-needs to be paperless
-I wish the uniform is different from NHS colors

pros: Buildings are near Regent's Park

review_title: A good company with a good reputation.

The CEO was incredibly friendly and approachable when I met him, asked me for my first impressions and was interested to hear my answers.
cons: I haven't experienced any yet.

review_title: Care based on values centred leadership

cons: Honestly, struggling to find cons. All workplaces have their challenges, and its no different - expect to work hard, and be recognised for it. If you perform well, you may find yourself being given even more opportunity

review_title: I do not recommend anyone work here. Do not look after their stuff. Corrupt.
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in London, England
pros: I was offered a bank job which took 1 year to sort out.
cons: So I was offered a bank job which took around 1 year to sort out.  I was told to attend a shadow shift, and was not told why. I would only be paid once I had worked 70 hours.  But this was not training! This was actually work. Anyway I had hand over and then came over feeling ill but I also get panic attacks. I asked to go home at lunch and was told no go now incase you give something to the patients.  Anyway I went home and later received a shocking email that my behaviour was unacceptable and they are removing my name from bank pool without any explanation. I think this is appalling behavior. But anyway do not trust this hospital. They have no clue how to manage people. I reported to the chief executive and had no response.

review_title: Fantastic place to work, grow and develop
pros: I have been at the Clinic for nearly 3 years and love working here.     The culture is welcoming, everyone wants to support each other and it feels like we are all working towards a common goal of being the best we can whether we work on the clinical or non clinical side.      It is also so encouraging to see colleagues grow and develop, for example a Catering Assistant moving to a Theatre Coordinator role, a Porter developing as a Healthcare Assistant.
cons: It is a competitive market place and staff can sometimes feel stretched when replacements for leavers are not found immediately.   We are always looking at new approaches to attract new hires and retaining existing staff to minimise this.

pros: Absolutely loved my time working here. It gave me so much opportunity to grow and develop in my career. Internal progression is brilliant. People genuinely care about you and act like a family. For a large organisation it has a smaller community feel, in the best way possible. Fun training courses and emphasis on having great managers in place.
cons: Clinical staff often felt lack of recognition which was disappointing to hear because of the great work they do.

pros: Good technology and many good staff, most surgeons are good with many of those who suffers from medical school syndrome rude arrogance.
cons: Bullying managers, limited promotion opportunity especially if you not a native , and have an accent . Those who do the hard work are hardly recognised and preferential treatment to anything but non white

review_title: Proud to work for the clinic
pros:
Proud to work for such a prestigious hospital
The clinic is keen to re-invest in both services and individuals
Providing the best quality care for the patients
Supportive environment from management
Friendly working environment, with very approachable staff
Pioneering, quality care for patients in excellent facilities
cons: Struggling to think of something for this mandatory field

pros: I've worked at the Clinic for about three years and I have found it one of the friendliest places to work. Everyone - clinical and non-clinical is focussed on providing the best care to our patients. There are opportunities to develop and the Clinic really cares for its employees. The canteen is also great.
cons: Work can be demanding at times like any hospital.
